description: From translingual Synapsida, from syn- + Ancient Greek ἁψίς (hapsís, “arch”).

adjectives.description: synapsid (comparative more synapsid, superlative most synapsid)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to the class Synapsida, of animals which have an opening low in the skull roof behind each eye, leaving a bony arch beneath each.
examples: We are synapsid tetrapods, a group of reptiles that almost went extinct 200 million years ago in competition with the better-designed dinosaurs.

entries.meaning: Any animal (including all mammals) of the class Synapsida.
